[SYNTAX]: Occasionally lengthy, complex sentences may impede smooth reading flow.
[LEXICON]: Archaisms ("dernier cri") and formal tone might slightly disrupt readability for some readers.

[TRANSITION]: Mildly abrupt shift from tram scene to street navigation (e.g., conductor’s joke to following the official).
[STRUCTURE]: Humorous anecdotes (e.g., boy’s prank) feel loosely integrated into the primary narrative arc.

[LEXICON]: Anachronistic "GPS signal recalibrated" disrupts historical context.
[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures (e.g., "For the next five minutes...") may slightly impede flow.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from chase to quarry entering a villa without buildup.
